title: Vondrousova injury puts Sabalenka in Open semis
content: Marketa Vondrousova withdrew from the US Open on Tuesday with an injured knee, sending her quarterfinal opponent Aryna Sabalenka to the semifinals via walkover.

title: Sources: Bucs, RT Goedeke reach $90M extension
content: The Buccaneers and right tackle Luke Goedeke have reached agreement on a four-year, $90 million extension with $50 million guaranteed, sources told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

title: Hold that, Tiger: Kelly asks if Dabo saw 2nd half
content: After Dabo Swinney gave his grades for Saturday's game -- "they made a 65; we made a 58" -- LSU's Brian Kelly questioned if the Clemson coach saw the second half.

title: Sanders bites back over Buffs' clock management
content: A feisty Deion Sanders is pushing back against anyone second-guessing his clock management or calling out his coaching staff.

title: Fever's Clark does 5-on-0 work; still not cleared
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark participated in full court, 5-on-0 work during shootaround Tuesday but still hasn't been cleared for contract drills.

title: Buckeyes seize No. 1; LSU, Canes rise as Tide fall
content: Ohio State climbed to No. 1 in the AP Top 25 college football poll as LSU and Miami moved into the top five. FSU entered at No. 14, while Alabama fell to No. 21.

title: Jon Jones cleared in case involving Feb. accident
content: Former UFC heavyweight champion Jon Jones had all charges dropped after he was accused of fleeing the scene of an accident, with a New Mexico district attorney's office saying Jones had a "credible" alibi.

title: Sinner cursed? Drake bets $300K on US Open win
content: Drake is betting big on Jannik Sinner, wagering $300,000 on the top-ranked men's tennis player in the world to win the 2025 US Open.

title: üîÆ NFL season preview: Predictions and concerns
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: The enigma of Carlos Alcaraz
content: How can Carlos Alcaraz be so feared on the court -- but somehow beloved off of it? It's never been more apparent than at the US Open.

title: How the relationship between Micah Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: Miami is awesome! Arch isn't! We overreact to Week 1
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: Which teams will dominate September? Our MLB experts make final-month predictions
content: With less than a month left to play in the 2025 regular season, here's what our experts think will happen the rest of the way.

title: Welcome to September! Ranking the MLB playoff races that will rule the final month

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: 'Just getting started:' Why Lamar Jackson believes he can take his game to another level
content: Jackson is only a few months removed from one of the best seasons by a quarterback in NFL history, and he still expects to get better.

title: Worst transfers of the window, ranked: From Cunha to Isak, 13 big moves that might fail
content: This summer transfer window had its share of good moves, but we're ranking the 13 worst ones. Did Man United, Liverpool and Arsenal mess up?

title: How did Liverpool afford their $600 million summer of spending?
content: Liverpool won the Premier League title last season but went on a spending spree. Why? And how did they do it?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Top 25 rankings: Every team's top awards candidate
content: From Purdue's Braden Smith to NC State's Will Wade, we're on early awards watch for these candidates from Top 25 teams.

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
content: The long, undistinguished final arc of Dwight Howard's career masks just how high he climbed at his peak.

title: Where the 2025 class stacks up for NBA, WNBA
content: Ahead of enshrinement weekend, let's take a closer look at where this year's class ranks in both leagues.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: College football betting lines: Michigan heads to Oklahoma in ranked showdown
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Michigan-Oklahoma, Arizona State-Mississippi State and every Top 25 matchup.

title: College football betting: Should you bet on Garrett Nussmeier to win the Heisman?
content: As the odds shift each week for the Heisman Trophy, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Simulating the entire season: The biggest storylines from one possible outcome
content: We played out on of the Football Power Index's 10,000 season sims, from Week 1 through Super Bowl LX.

title: How Sam Darnold's one season with the 49ers prepared him for the Seahawks
content: Darnold's long NFL journey has led him to the Seahawks, but his transformative year was spent with thwe 49ers.

title: Hunter Renfrow missed multiple Panthers callbacks due to daughters watching 'Bluey'
content: Renfrow's daughters didn't let their father know about the calls because they were interrupting the popular animated children's show.

title: How Oscar Piastri changed the fate of McLaren and Alpine
content: Three years ago, a court ruled that Oscar Piastri's move from Alpine to McLaren could go through. Now, he leads the drivers' championship while Alpine is dead last in the constructors'. What changed?

title: Backyard Football '99 re-release date announced for PC and mobile
content: The latest modernized edition of a Backyard Sports game will come to PC, iOS and Android this September.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Bar√ßa eye Gu√©hi after Liverpool deal fails
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid are interested in a pre-contract agreement for Marc Gu√©hi. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS: Philadelphia jumps San Diego into top spot
content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: 10 big fights that define their careers
content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes appointment of 26 new judges to Allahabad High Court
content: The Collegium, in two separate proposals, has recommended 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, the latter batch of which include two senior women lawyers from the Supreme Court Bar¬†

title: J&K Opposition parties express dismay over constructing Police Martyrs‚Äô building on 70-year-old playground in Srinagar
content: PDP leader and Pulwama MLA Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra said the land for the Police Martyrs‚Äô building has been a playground for 70 years; JKAP president Syed Altaf Bukhari termed the police‚Äôs move as ‚Äúdeeply concerning‚Äù

title: U.P. government orders probe into lathi charge on ABVP activists in Barabanki, CO removed
content: The incident happened on Monday (September 1, 2025) when ABVP workers and students staged a protest at the Shri Ram Swaroop Memorial University in Barabanki, alleging that the university is accepting admissions in LLB course even after its recognition was cancelled

title: Behind Maratha quota issue resolution, a climbdown by both the Mahayuti government and the activist
content: Over the last few days, the Cabinet subcommittee on Maratha reservation held four meetings. Drafts for the orders were kept ready, but the government maintained that it was firm on finding a constitutional solution to the deadlock

title: Hyderabad launches cyber innovation hub to strengthen digital security
content: The initiative, housed within IIIT Hyderabad campus, spans more than 3,000 square feet and is equipped with specialised tools and infrastructure dedicated to cybersecurity

title: Consumer Commission comes down heavily on LIC
content: The bench strongly criticised LIC for attempting to repudiate claims while being willing to issue policies to vulnerable clients

title: Student anger spills over as SFI stages protests over pending fee reimbursement¬†
content: According to SFI State committee, the State government owes ‚Çπ8,158 crore dues towards RTF in the past six years

title: Faridabad Deputy Commissioner visits ‚Äòsensitive‚Äô villages, urges residents to shift to safe homes due to rising water levels
content: Deputy Commissioner Vikram Singh visited the sensitive villages to take stock of the situation and made an appeal to the villagers to shift to the safe homes built by the administration in time

title: Disciplinary action initiated against 94 Excise officials for dereliction of duty
content: A digital system was being implemented in the Department, and permission has been given to renew the license online once every 5 years: Minister

title: Karnataka High Court stays NMC‚Äôs action; permits admission for MBBS course in Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College in Belagavi for 2025-26
content: THe High Court of Karnataka has stayed the National Medical Commission‚Äôs decision of not permitting students to the first-year MBBS course for 2025-26 in the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belagavi, based on bribery allegations

title: BJP delegation asks BC commission to drop Christian sub-castes listed for survey
content: The BJP urged the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, headed by Madhusudan R. Naik, to drop Christian ‚Äòsub castes‚Äô listed in the draft list of castes ahead of the socio-educational survey of the State population

title: Madras High Court reserves orders on Devanathan Yadav‚Äôs bail plea in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund Nidhi Ltd case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran wonders how the finance company will recover dues from its borrowers if EOW keeps it sealed for over one year

title: Army Vehicle intercepted by Kolkata Police for reckless driving
content: The incident occurred at about 11 a.m. on Tuesday (September 2, 2025) and the military truck was stopped by Kolkata Police after it came close to the vehicle of Kolkata Police Commissioner Manoj Kumar Verma

title: Bihar Cabinet approves plan to open seven medical colleges across seven districts
content: Bihar Cabinet sanctions ‚Çπ20,000 crore to roll out Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, approves the creation of 3,233 posts in different government departments, among other major decisions

title: CBI arrests two persons in ‚Äòreverse trap‚Äô case
content: ‚ÄúIn a commendable act of integrity, the Superintendent in GST Intelligence played a pivotal role in the CBI operation that led to the arrest of two private individuals on bribery charge,‚Äù a CBI official said

title: West Bengal Assembly debates harassment on Bengali speaking migrants in other States
content: Minister Chandrima Bhattacharya said that the national anthem is written in Bengali and no person in the country can deny that

title: West Bengal LOP suspended from Assembly for creating ruckus in the House
content: Suvendu Adhikari raised objections to a remark by State‚Äôs Education Minister Bratya Basu directed at Army during a debate in the House

title: Governors cannot sit over Bills endlessly, say Supreme Court judges
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justices Vikram Nath and P.S. Narasimha separately remark that Governors could neither delay the wisdom of the legislature indefinitely nor impede the functioning of the Constitution; Tamil Nadu and West Bengal seek collaboration, not combat, among high offices

title: BJP‚Äôs women leaders slam Opposition over insults to Modi‚Äôs mother
content: The pain felt by the PM is also being perceived by the people of Bihar and the entire country, says Nirmala Sitharaman, demanding an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi Yadav

title: Singapore Prime Minister begins 3-day visit to India
content: Lawrence Wong will hold talks with Modi, Jaishankar, Pradhan; External Affairs Ministry says the visit will provide an opportunity to review the robust relation between the two countries

title: Foreigners Tribunals can issue arrest warrants, send ‚Äòforeigners‚Äô to detention centres
content: A new order gives Foreigners Tribunals powers of a first class judicial magistrate; it bars foreigners from taking jobs in the fields of defence, nuclear energy and human rights

title: COP-30 to focus on known solutions, says its President
content: The UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) will hold its 30th Conference of Parties (COP-30) in November, in the Brazilian port city of Belem, a gateway to the Amazonian rainforest.

title: Hindus should avoid Halal meat to protect Sanatana Dharma: Giriraj Singh
content: Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) asks Union Minister to speak on jobs instead of lecturing people on food habits

title: Sasikanth Senthil says he is not after the post of Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president
content: The Tiruvallur MP says that he decided to end the protest because he managed to highlight the issue of non-disbursal of  funds under Samagra¬†Shiksha¬†Abhiyan to Tamil Nadu and a few other States

title: J&K parties unhappy over ‚Äòdenial of protocol‚Äô to CM Omar Abdullah during Amit Shah‚Äôs Jammu visit
content: The statements of the political parties came after several pictures went viral on social media and attracted the attention of netizens

title: Madras High Court appoints one-man commission to probe alleged police excess while quelling Chennai conservancy workers‚Äô protest
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan request retired judge V. Parthiban to act as a one-man commission and submit a report as expeditiously as possible

title: Steamrolling ethanol-blended petrol puts seasoned mechanic, customers in trouble
content: Use of ethanol-blended petrol (E-20) is causing mechanical issues in the functioning of fuel system, including carburettor and engine, of vehicles

title: CPI State-level conference passes 11 resolutions
content: The party urges the State Election Commission to conduct polls to local bodies every five years without fail

title: Government‚Äôs Onam season spending to cross ‚Çπ20,000 crore
content: Government is spending ‚Çπ12,100 crore on salaries and pensions, Onam bonus and festival allowance, Onam advance, DA and dearness relief, benefitting over 13 lakh government employees, workers and pensioners, according to Finance Minister

title: Now it is Kavitha but in 2013 Vijayashanti too faced same treatment
content: Other known tough action was sacking then Deputy Chief Minister Dr. T. Rajaiah charges of corruption in 2015

title: Chief Minister to open State-level Onam Week celebrations on Wednesday
content: Actors Ravi Mohan (Jayam Ravi) and Basil Joseph to be guests of honour; drone show, indigenous art forms, and cultural procession to be highlights of extravaganza

title: Tamil Nadu secures 23 more deals in Germany worth more than ‚Çπ3,800¬†crore
content: With this, 26¬†MoUs, entailing an investment of ‚Çπ7,020¬†crore¬†with the potential to create 15,320 jobs, were signed during the Chief Minister‚Äôs visit to the European nation

title: India, Thailand Armies begin joint exercise in Meghalaya
content: Aimed at enhancing interoperability and mutual understanding, the exercise is part of the ongoing military-to-military exchange programme between the two nations

title: Indian Navy‚Äôs first training squadron docks in Seychelles on long-range deployment
content: The visit will include professional exchanges, cross-deck visits, and joint training with Seychelles Defence Forces personnel

title: India warns Pakistan of likely flooding in Sutlej amid heavy rains: sources
content: The alerts were routed to Islamabad through the Ministry of External Affairs on "humanitarian grounds", sources told PTI

title: Maoists kill two villagers in Chhattisgarh‚Äôs Sukma
content: The total number of civilians killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh this year has touched 36 with these fatalities

title: Opposition to hold training session for MPs before Vice-Presidential election¬†
content: Opposition‚Äôs candidate Justice B. Sudershan Reddy issues an appeal to all MPs seeking their support in the election

title: Onam soars high in Malappuram despite scholarly caution
content: Islamic scholars from both traditional and reformist backgrounds caution Muslim community against participating in Onam celebrations.  However, the youth on campuses were in high spirits, immersing themselves in festivities with gusto. They revel in traditional dress, music, dance, games and the festive feast served on banana leaves

title: SUCI(C) stages protest against SIR in Dharwad
content: The opposition parties which are protesting against vote theft are themselves the biggest beneficiaries of it while in power: Aldalli

title: Madhya Pradesh HC judge recuses himself from mining case after BJP MLA ‚Äòtried to call him to discuss the matter‚Äô
content: The petition was against some companies linked to BJP MLA and former State Minister Sanjay Pathak‚Äôs family for alleged illegal mining

title: Kopparthi Industrial Hub will make rapid strides in industrialisation, says Lokesh
content: The Minister reiterates commitment to ensuring gender equity, and says that the government believes in rendering justice to every citizen, irrespective of the gender, and assures that women of Kadapa region will have ample jobs in the future

title: "Was Very Active": Trump Dismisses Ill Health Rumours As "Fake"
content: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said reports on social media that he is in ill health are untrue, saying he was busy over the Labor Day weekend giving media interviews and visiting his Virginia golf club.

title: Trump Says 11 Killed In US Strike On Drug-Carrying Boat From Venezuela
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that the U.S. has carried out a strike in the southern Caribbean against a drug-carrying vessel that departed from Venezuela.

title: 25 Killed, Dozens Injured In Three Bomb Blasts In Pakistan
content: A bomb killed 11 people in the Pakistani city of Quetta on Tuesday when it went off in the parking area of a rally held to commemorate the anniversary of the death of a nationalist leader, government official Hamza Shafaat said.

title: Google Not Required To Sell Chrome, Court Rules In Antitrust Ruling
content: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered a major makeover of Google's search engine in a crackdown aimed at curbing the corrosive power of an illegal monopoly, but rebuffed the U.S. government's request to break up the company.

title: "We Get Along With India Very Well, But...": Trump On Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump said America gets along with India very well but the relationship was "one-sided" for many years since New Delhi was charging Washington "tremendous tariffs".

title: Trump Says "Very Disappointed" With Putin Over No Deal On Ukraine In Alaska
content: US President Donald Trump said in a radio interview Tuesday he was "very disappointed" by Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin's failure to reach a peace deal on Ukraine after their summit in Alaska.

title: Row In Karnataka Congress As MLA Claims Party Colleague Ready To Join BJP
content: Factionalism in Karnataka Congress played out in public today with leaders belonging to Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar factions and ripping into each other.

title: Youth Dies After Pilot Car In Trinamool MLA's Convoy Hits Motorbike
content: A man was killed after his motorbike was hit by the pilot car in Trinamool Congress MLA Saokat Molla's convoy in South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal on Tuesday, police said.

title: Case Filed Against Airport Authority Manager In Rs 232-Crore Fraud Case
content: The CBI has registered an FIR against a senior manager of the Airport Authority of India for allegedly siphoning off more than Rs 232 crore into his personal accounts through a complex trail of fictitious accounting entries in three years

title: India-Thailand Joint Military Exercise 'Maitree' Underway In Meghalaya
content: Army contingents of India and Thailand are taking part in a fortnight-long joint military exercise in Meghalaya, with a focus on company-level counter-terrorist operations in semi-urban terrain under a UN Charter, officials said on Tuesday.

title: India Delivers 21 Tonnes Of Relief Materials To Quake-Hit Afghanistan
content: India on Tuesday delivered 21 tonnes of relief materials to Afghanistan as part of its assistance to earthquake-hit people of that country.

title: 2 Weeks After Attack, Rekha Gupta To Resume 'Jan Sunwai' Today Amid Heavy Security
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta will resume the 'Jan Sunwai' programme at her camp office on Wednesday, amid beefed-up security arrangements including the deployment of plain-clothed policemen and screening of individuals with a facial recognition s

title: Pre-Independence-Era Gazettes Hogged Limelight During Maratha Quota Protest
content: Two pre-independence-era gazettes, one of the issued by the rulers of the erstwhile Hyderabad state, were focus of the latest phase of Maratha quota protest in Mumbai led by activist Manoj Jarange.

title: SC/ST Act Brought To Improve Conditions Of Vulnerable Class: Supreme Court
content: The Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act was brought with an "avowed object" to improve socio-economic conditions of a vulnerable class and prohibits the grant of pre-arrest bail to the accused, the Supreme Court said.

title: "Pakistan Respects Russia's Relations With India": Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif To Putin
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Tuesday that his country respects Russia's relations with India, as he called for strengthening Islamabad's ties with Moscow during his talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin here.

title: 5 Dead In House Collapses, 1,337 Roads Closed, Schools Shut In Himachal Pradesh
content: Five people were killed in house collapse incidents as torrential rains triggered landslides and flash floods across Himachal Pradesh on Tuesday, blocking 1,337 roads, including four national highways, officials said.

title: This Massive Black Hole May Have Formed In Early Big Bang Era
content: Until now, scientists thought stars and galaxies formed first, and black holes appeared later after the earliest stars ran out of fuel and collapsed.

title: Russia, China Sign Deal For New Gas Pipeline In Major Political Win
content: Russia's Gazprom PJSC said it signed a legally binding agreement to build the long-anticipated Power of Siberia 2 gas pipeline to China via Mongolia and would expand deliveries through other routes.

title: Noida Schools Shut On Wednesday Due To Heavy Rainfall
content: Schools in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar district will remain closed for students from nursery to Class 12 on Wednesday as heavy rains are predicted for the day, according to an official order.

title: "Trump Feels Cheated That...": US Expert On India-US Tariff Row
content: US Strategic Affairs Expert Ashley J. Tellis said that US President Donald Trump feels "cheated" that he did not get the credit for resolving the India-Pakistan conflict in May 2025.

title: 'Entitled ones': PM Modi's jab at Tejashwi, Rahul; 'kaamdaar vs naamdaar' returns before Bihar polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized the RJD and Congress, accusing them of disrespecting his late mother and insulting womanhood during a recent political event in Bihar. Addressing a large gathering of women, he urged them to hold the opposition accountable for their actions and sought their blessings for the upcoming elections.

title: ‚ÄòOne-sided relationship‚Äô: Trump repeats tariff charge on India; cites Harley Davidson
content: President Trump criticized India's high tariffs, citing Harley Davidson as an example of unfair trade practices. He claimed India imposed substantial tariffs while the US allowed Indian goods without similar barriers.

title: ‚ÄòWhy not step into governor‚Äôs shoes?‚Äô: SC on bills row; TN seeks timelines
content: The Supreme Court questioned Tamil Nadu's defense of deemed assent for delayed bills, raising concerns about potentially overstepping into the governor's role. West Bengal, while supporting the opposition's stance against the Presidential Reference, argued that governors possess discretionary powers under Article 200.

title: Pakistan: 11 killed, 40 injured after suicide bombing at political rally; probe on
content: A suicide bombing at a Balochistan National Party rally in Quetta, Pakistan, resulted in at least 11 fatalities and 18 injuries. The explosion took place in the stadium parking area where hundreds of BNP supporters had congregated. Emergency services responded swiftly, and an investigation has been initiated, though no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

title: Kishtwar floods: What led to the tragedy that claimed 65 lives? Officials share findings
content: A preliminary investigation revealed that dual cloudbursts, not a glacial lake outburst flood, triggered the devastating flash floods in Kishtwar's Chasoti village on August 14, resulting in 65 fatalities. A prior government study had already warned of GLOF risks in vulnerable tehsils like Padder, Machail, Dachhan, Marwah, and Warwan, highlighting their susceptibility to sudden flooding events.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college: Parents reaction; money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the world's youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her early entrepreneurial spirit to her frugal upbringing. Despite her parents' emphasis on academics, she dropped out of Carnegie Mellon to pursue the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's childhood hustles, from selling Pok√©mon cards to creating online gaming tools, laid the foundation for her success with companies like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Bengal assembly erupts: TMC, BJP spar over Army stage row; Suvendu Adhikari suspended
content: The Bengal assembly witnessed uproar following the Army's action. The Army tried to remove a Trinamool protest stage. This led to Suvendu Adhikari's suspension during a special session. The session addressed attacks on Bengali migrant workers. Minister Bratya Basu compared the Army's action to the Pakistani Army's 1971 actions. BJP legislators protested Basu's remarks.

title: 'I was left penniless, my stuff moved out of home': Indrani Mukerjea's daughter
content: Vidhie Mukerjea, a key witness, alleges forged statements and accuses Rahul and Rabin Mukerjea of siphoning Indrani's assets after her arrest. She claims they took jewellery and savings, leaving Indrani unable to defend herself, and that Rabin threatened her.

title: Meta Al reshuffle: Head Alexandr Wang sends memo to staff; Makes one thing clear
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: George Raveling: Who was the legendary coach? a look back on his career
content: George Raveling, the iconic college basketball coach and former Nike executive, has passed away at 88 after battling cancer. Inducted into the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame in 2015, Raveling broke barriers as the first Black head coach in the Pacific-8 Conference. His family shared the news, highlighting his lasting impact on countless lives through his wisdom and kindness.

title: Rajasthan govt drops Centre‚Äôs age cap for enrolment in coaching centres
content: The Rajasthan government, led by Bhajan Lal Sharma, is set to introduce a revised coaching center bill that defies Union education ministry guidelines by not imposing a minimum age for enrollment. This decision, criticized by the opposition, comes after a drop in coaching industry enrollments and relaxes penalties for violations.

title: Proposed 40% GST will cripple business, says top casino operator
content: Delta Corp has put its Rs 2,000-2,500 crore integrated resort-cum-casino township project in Goa on hold due to uncertainty surrounding potential GST slab changes. The company fears that a proposed 40% GST rate on casinos would render the sector unviable, impacting jobs, tourism, and revenue collection. Delta Corp is also concerned about retrospective GST demands.

title: Trademark fight in India: Bombay HC to Cognizant; You cannot use logo till case ends
content: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's use of its logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order that had allowed Cognizant to continue using the logo.

title: Indore shocker: Newborn bit by rats in NICU dies; staff suspended, probe ordered
content: A newborn, bitten by rats in MY Hospital's NICU, has died, sparking outrage and investigations. Hospital officials claim the death was due to the infant's fragile health, not the rat bites. Disciplinary actions have been taken, including suspensions and show-cause notices to staff. An inquiry committee has been formed, and the pest control agency fined.

title: Cheque bounce convict can make deal, avoid jail: SC
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that individuals convicted in cheque bounce cases can avoid jail time by reaching a compromise with the complainant. The court emphasized that cheque dishonor is primarily a civil wrong, making convictions unsustainable once a compromise deed is signed.

title: MP HC judge recuses from mining case after BJP MLA's bid to contact him
content: Justice Vishal Mishra withdrew from an illegal mining case. This happened after Sanjay Pathak, a BJP MLA, contacted him. Pathak's son and mother are directors of Nirmala Minerals. The company faces accusations of illegal mining in Jabalpur and Katni. A petition was filed after inaction on a complaint. The case is now before the Chief Justice.

title: Micah Parsons FaceTimes heartbroken Cowboys fan, vows to make him proud
content: After a shocking trade sent Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers, a young Cowboys fan's emotional reaction went viral. Parsons responded with empathy, FaceTiming the child, offering encouragement, and promising a Packers jersey. Green Bay then signed Parsons to a record-breaking contract, setting the stage for his return to Dallas as a Packer.

title: Paulina Gretzky stuns in gothic look on Italy trip with Dustin Johnson
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of Wayne Gretzky and wife of Dustin Johnson, is making waves with her daring all-black ensemble during her Italian getaway. Showcasing her evolving style on the LTK app, Gretzky's look features a mix of edgy and luxury pieces, including a Helsa Poplin Bra and Bottega Veneta mules.

title: Brittany Mahomes: Some women are disrespectful pursuing Patrick
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has addressed her past insecurities regarding attention from other women towards her husband. She admitted that disrespectful behavior from some women used to bother her. However, Brittany has grown to a point where she is unbothered and focused on her family with Patrick, whom she met in high school.

title: ‚ÄòWe will remove you‚Äô: UK warns foreign students over 'fake asylum'
content: The UK Home Office will send texts to Indian students. The texts will warn against making false asylum claims to stay in the UK. Overstaying visas will lead to removal. This action comes as the UK aims to reduce asylum claims. The government wants to close asylum hotels. Many asylum claims are from those already in the UK on visas.

title: Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; Delhi continues to resist US pressure
content: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

title: UP man gets death penalty for rape, murder of 8-yr-old Dalit girl
content: In Mathura, a special SC/ST court sentenced a 50-year-old man to death for the 2020 abduction, rape, and murder of an eight-year-old Dalit girl. The court deemed it a "rarest of rare case" due to its brutality. The autopsy revealed horrific injuries, including severe damage to the victim's private parts and internal organs.

title: ‚ÄòMinnesota royalty‚Äô: Justin Jefferson, Suni Lee‚Äôs State Fair photo stuns fans
content: The Minnesota State Fair became a celebrity hotspot when Vikings' Justin Jefferson and Olympic gymnast Sunisa Lee were spotted together, igniting social media. Lee shared a photo on Instagram, quickly turning the internet into a commentary section, with fans dubbing them "Minnesota royalty." This surprise crossover highlighted the pride and excitement surrounding these two homegrown stars.

title: Noida & Ghaziabad schools closed today after heavy rain
content: Due to heavy rainfall and flood-like situations across the NCR, district authorities in Noida and Ghaziabad have ordered all schools, from nursery to Class 12, to remain closed on Wednesday, September 3, 2025. The decision prioritizes student safety amidst the India Meteorological Department's forecast of very heavy showers in western Uttar Pradesh, leading to waterlogging in low-lying areas.

title: Maratha quota stir: Apology in court & then a win for Jarange - how it unfolded
content: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange declared victory after the Maharashtra government accepted key demands, including Kunbi caste certificates for eligible Marathas. Celebrations erupted in Mumbai as Jarange ended his hunger strike. The government issued a resolution on the Hyderabad Gazetteer and will form committees to verify Kunbi caste claims.

title: ‚ÄòMeant to be‚Äô: Taylor Swift‚Äôs 2012 interview resurfaces; fans link it to Travis Kelce
content: An old interview of Taylor Swift from 2012 has resurfaced, where she expressed her desire for a relationship that is open and lives in the light. Fans are drawing parallels between this statement and her current public romance with Travis Kelce, contrasting it with her previous private relationship with Joe Alwyn.

title: Half of US workers secretly use AI: 8 workplace trends redefining jobs
content: A new report suggests Artificial Intelligence is becoming a silent co-worker. Hybrid work models are now common. Digital collaboration tools are vital for teamwork. Mental health support is a key priority for companies. Diversity and inclusion efforts are gaining importance. Sustainability is influencing business decisions. Upskilling is essential for career growth. Leadership styles are adapting to build trust.

title: UK cheerleader Laken Snelling arrested: Baby found dead in closet; investigation underway
content: Laken Ashlee Snelling, a University of Kentucky cheerleader, was arrested after a newborn baby was found dead in a closet near the campus. Snelling admitted to being the mother and concealing the birth, leading to charges of abuse of a corpse, tampering with evidence, and concealing the birth of an infant. She is currently under home incarceration after posting bond.

title: Over 1,400 dead: Why 6.0 earthquake in Afghanistan claimed so many lives
content: A devastating 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, resulting in over 1,400 deaths and 3,000 injuries in Kunar province alone. The shallow depth of the quake and vulnerable mud-brick homes contributed to the high casualty rate. This disaster compounds Afghanistan's existing crises, including reduced aid funding and a struggling economy, hindering rescue and relief efforts.

title: 'Little bit of geopolitical issues': Goyal says India-US trade deal likely 'by Nov or so'
content: India and the US are currently engaged in negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, despite recent tariff impositions by the US and concerns over India's trade relations with Russia. India has set firm boundaries, particularly regarding its agricultural and dairy sectors.

title: Why Pakistan and Afghanistan players observed silence before T20I clash
content: Before the Pakistan-Afghanistan Tri-Series match in Sharjah, a minute's silence honored victims of Afghanistan's earthquake and Pakistan's floods. Players stood in respect as Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan shared his grief over the 6.0-magnitude earthquake that devastated eastern Afghanistan, killing hundreds and causing widespread destruction. The disaster prompted prayers and condolences from the cricketing world.

title: Explained: How 5-yr-old became youngest female with FIDE ratings across chess formats
content: Aarini Lahoty, a five-year-old chess prodigy from Delhi, has achieved a remarkable feat by earning FIDE ratings in classical, rapid, and blitz chess formats. She is the youngest girl globally to achieve this milestone and the first Indian player born in 2019 to do so. She now holds ratings of 1553 (classical), 1550 (rapid) and 1498 (blitz).

title: ‚ÄòNo words to capture‚Äô: George Raveling dies at 88; Nike deal remembered
content: George Raveling, the esteemed basketball coach and Nike executive instrumental in bringing Michael Jordan to the brand, has passed away at 88 after battling cancer. His coaching career spanned several universities, earning him numerous accolades and a Hall of Fame induction. Beyond basketball, Raveling played a significant role in preserving Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Indian Football: SC order directs AIFF to invite bids for new partners
content: The Supreme Court has directed the AIFF to initiate measures for the upcoming football season, including issuing tenders for new commercial partners to conduct the Indian Super League. This order aims to resolve the uncertainty that arose after the previous contract with FSDL ended, impacting player salaries and pre-season training.

title: Musk warns against contraceptives: Study links to brain changes
content: Elon Musk's recent post on X has ignited a global discussion. The post relates to a study on hormonal contraceptives. The study suggests possible effects on brain function. It also mentions emotional regulation and memory. Concerns are rising about underestimated medication side effects. The side effects particularly affect women. Experts call for more research and clearer communication.

title: Kim arrives in Beijing; to attend military parade alongside Putin, Xi
content: Kim Jong Un arrived in Beijing for a military parade. He will attend with Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin. This marks Kim's first multilateral event. Meetings between Kim and Putin are under consideration. North Korea has been aiding Russia in the Ukraine war. Kim seeks to strengthen ties with China.

title: Expectations dashed, Manning and Belichick need to rebuild

title: Stafford embarking on Year 17, will he - and his back - make the most of it?
